After your Room has been shared, you can add and remove comments, and share your lot to Facebook.</Text> <Text Key="235CB853">Save to Gallery</Text> <Text Key="653CB31C">Once you get going in Build, you will want to familiarize yourself with the various tools that are available to make customizing your home easier. Eyedropper, Sledgehammer, Design Tool, Move House, Select, and Bulldoze Lot... to name a few.

So dig in, and start building!</Text> <Text Key="2F35A70B">Use the Day/Night indicator to change the lighting in Build Mode in order to view your lot under different lighting conditions. The lighting does not persist when you exit Build Mode.</Text> <Text Key="E07C258C">Build Mode</Text> <Text Key="2BB8C2F4">This lesson will provide a quick overview of the features available in Build Mode! To learn more, select any lesson from this Lessons panel. Or, enter Build Mode and just start clicking around to see what happens.</Text> <Text Key="E41A2479">To get started click on the Build Mode button in the upper right.

ProTip: You can also use F2 to jump directly to the Objects by Room catalog, or F3 to get into the Build catalog.</Text> <Text Key="3F287D03">Start in the Rooms and Walls sort to begin building your home by plopping down fully furnished rooms from the Styled Rooms sub-sort. Or craft your own rooms by clicking on the Empty Rooms and Walls sub-sort.</Text> <Text Key="C70CE123">Use the Build catalog to add doors, windows, roofs, floors, adjust the foundation, or add architectural flourishes like spandrels, roof attachments, trims, and friezes.

Or change the patterns of the roof, floor, and walls; add a fence, gate, stairs, columns, outdoor décor and a fountain, or just paint the terrain. Go nuts!</Text> <Text Key="A05A1A8D">To begin furnishing your home choose between the Objects by Room catalog, where you can imagine the décor of your home room by room. Or the Objects by Function catalog, when you would rather search for a specific functional need.</Text> <Text Key="18CA4B9A">Can't find what you seek? Try Search. Just type what you are looking for and hit enter (or choose from the suggested items that pop up as you type).

Filters can help to narrow down your search to a specific color or style.</Text> <Text Key="BF54497B">Build Mode has several tools to help you build your perfect home.

The toolbar can be found in Build Mode along the top of the screen.</Text> <Text Key="36057D98">The Select tool is used to select objects and architecture found on your lot.

While using any other tool, hitting [Esc] will always return to the Select tool.</Text> <Text Key="5A4FF14D">The Eyedropper tool is used to copy the properties of a placed object or pattern, as well as some architectural elements (such as fences and spandrels).

Clicking on what you want to copy will attach a copy onto the cursor, as well as open to the home location of the copied item in the catalog.</Text> <Text Key="3ED93F9A">Choose the Sledgehammer tool to delete and destroy.

Click on an object to delete it. Or click and drag to remove a group of similar items (all items to be deleted will highlight yellow).

Note: Bulldoze Lot is found in the Lot Info panel and is used to completely empty a lot. A warning, Bulldoze Lot can't be undone.</Text> <Text Key="E69C7ABF">The Design Tool can be used to quickly change the color choice of objects that have already been placed.

Select the Design Tool. Click on an object and choose a new color from the swatch pop up. You will not be charged Simoleons for changing colors.</Text> <Text Key="07A7636C">Click Undo to undo the last Build action. Click Redo to redo the last Build action.

Undo and Redo are saved per build session. Once you exit Build Mode, you will not be able to Undo or Redo any changes from a previous can get inside your creation and add a Door!

ProTip: In Live Mode, let the neighbors know where to go when they visit by clicking on any exterior door and choosing Set as Front Door.</Text> <Text Key="66C3F26C">To add a roof, click on Roofs and select one from the catalog. Once you click to place a roof, your floor view will change to make placement easier.

ProTip: A Room without a roof will be lit by the exterior lighting, and may not look the way you imagined it.</Text> <Text Key="2D308BD6">Build Catalog</Text> <Text Key="5CA4E254">If you're holding an item on your cursor, you can rotate it by tapping the . or , keys.</Text> <Text Key="3C7EA62A">Click to learn more about Doors.</Text> <Text Key="DB439298">Click on the Empty Rooms and Walls catalog or the Styled Rooms catalog to browse the different Rooms available.

Note: You can create multiple stories by clicking on the Floor Up and Floor Down arrows in the upper right, and then placing a Room on the upper floors.</Text> <Text Key="724D4620">Click on a Room in the Styled Rooms catalog to get a larger view of the Room. From here you can buy individual objects or buy and place the whole Room to quickly add a new addition to your house.

ProTip: Double click on a Room in the catalog to allow for quick placement of the entire Room.</Text> <Text Key="06DFA7A2">Doors can be sorted by height, or you can use the Show All sort and find the door height information in the hover tip for each door.

Note: If the door you want doesn't fit on your walls, adjust the wall height at any time by clicking on the Empty Rooms and Walls sort and choosing a wall height within the House Portrait.</Text> <Text Key="1648400E">You can also choose one of the suggested pop-ups that appear as you are typing.</Text> <Text Key="8A3ADBD6">The more expensive an object, the more likely it is to provide greater benefits to your Sims. Click the Open Filter Panel arrow at the top of any catalog to view the Filter options.</Text> <Text Key="EAACB0E9">As filters are turned on, they are added to the list above the catalog. So even when the panel is closed, you'll know what's being filtered.</Text> <Text Key="835CB320">Turning on Build Mode Filters will find all objects that satisfy any of the Filter choices within the current catalog.

To remove a filter, click on the [x] for the one you wish to remove, or click the Clear All button to start over.</Text> <Text Key="E54A1FCA">Filters can also be used to find all of the objects that have been unlocked. Select the Content Filter category, and choose Unlocks.</Text> <Text Key="C3BBCC3D">Filter Panel</Text> <Text Household Inventory.</Text> <Text Key="3E25D1D2">Click on the Household Inventory to open the catalog. Use the Function sort pop up and Filters to manage your view within the Household Inventory.

Note: Search will not find objects in the Household Inventory.</Text> <Text Key="A9E4CB56">Some actions will cause objects to be moved into the Household Inventory. These objects will highlight yellow. Completing the action will move all of the yellow highlighted objects to the Household Inventory.

You can also place objects into the Household Inventory by picking them up and clicking Place in Inventory.</Text> <Text Key="82EABF89">Similar objects added to the Household Inventory will create a stack. You can see how many a stack contains by the number next to the objects picture. Click on the number to expand the inventory to see the entire stack.</Text> <Text Key="397C3046">Household Inventory is only available in Build Mode for lots you own. Objects that you don't want to sell, that the game has moved for you, or in some cases that were delivered to you, can all end up in the Household Inventory.

Note: You will get a quick notification when an item is added to the Household Inventory.</Text> <Text Key="2B8537A8">Household Inventory</Text> <Text Wall Tool.</Text> <Text Key="75897BAB">While using the Wall Tool, you can hold the [shift] key to draw a rectangle instead of a single wall. You can also hold the [ctrl] key to destroy any wall it is drawn over.</Text> <Text Key="E1A1B1AB">When drawing walls, you may notice green and yellow highlights.

Green indicates the wall has passed through architecture that will be modified in some way.

Yellow indicates an object that will be moved to the Household Inventory, or sold.</Text> <Text Key="243A99A6">Click on the Rooms and Walls catalog and choose the Empty Rooms sort to find the Wall Tool. Use the Wall Tool to draw individual walls. The cost for placement is attached to the top of the Wall Tool as you drag.

Note: There is also a Room Tool that you can use to draw custom rooms.</Text> <Text Key="C3FACA3E">Select the Wall Tool and click to begin drawing a wall. Click again to complete the action.

If you draw an enclosed space with the Wall Tool, it will turn into a room with a floor. You can convert a wall into a room by selecting the wall and dragging the side arrows.

Note: Hit [Esc] to cancel any in progress Build action, such as drawing a wall.</Text> <Text Key="B5908378">Wall Tool</Text> <Text Whole House.</Text> <Text Key="A9C7B4D5">Click the Move House tool to move an entire structure to a new location on the lot.</Text> <Text Key="59A88E52">Selecting Move House will set the floor to the maximum floor level in order to see your entire structure.

De-selecting the tool will return you to your previously selected floor level.</Text> <Text Key="BE721399">Click on any room or wall to select all connected rooms and walls.

Use the Rotate and Move options in the context menu to reposition your home.</Text> <Text Key="505EE0A4">You can also use the Move House tool to quickly sell your home by clicking on the Sell button that appears when you pick it up.

To end the Move House operation hit [Esc] or select a different tool from the toolbar.</Text> <Text Key="65AE2E96">Move House</Text> <Text Key="5A1F654E">Click Catalog by Function.</Text> <Text Key="A79C4B55">Wall and Foundation height can be adjusted from within the Build Catalog.

You can adjust both of these at any time without worrying about damaging your home, though you may have to clean up your staircases if you remove your foundation.</Text> <Text Key="C335E746">Once you've built your house, you'll want to furnish it. Click on Objects by Room or Objects by Function to find everything you need to fill out your home.</Text> <Text Key="836FF405">Click on Objects by Room and select a room style from the options at the top such as Kitchen, Bedroom, or Study. Then click on the Room Portrait to find furnishings appropriate to your chosen room sort.</Text> <Text Key="29FB13D4">Choose Objects by Function and use the pop-up menu to view items by function, such as Electronics, Decorations, or Plumbing. Then click one of the sub-sort buttons to further narrow down your options.

Use the Show All sub-sort to view all of the choices within your function category selection.</Text> <Text Key="2DCE1B8F">New home builders might want to start in the Empty Rooms and Walls catalog, where you can find blocks, rooms, and walls to begin building.

The first two items in this catalog are the Wall and Room Tools. Use these to draw a custom room. Or select any of the other options to place pre-shaped rooms which you can customize to your liking.</Text> <Text Key="89766564">The Build Catalog is the home to all of the architectural elements found in Build Mode.

Hover your mouse over the various house parts in the catalog, and click to select the highlighted sort.

ProTip: [F3] is the shortcut for navigating directly to the Build Catalog.</Text> <Text Key="BD40BA6E">Objects by... Catalogs</Text> <Text Venues button.</Text> <Text Key="F3F30B2F">The Bulldoze Lot option is found in the Lot Info Panel. Clicking this will remove all objects and architecture from the lot (except the mailbox). This can't be undone, so a warning dialog will appear when you choose Bulldoze Lot to help prevent accidental demolition.</Text> <Text Key="E04F3D56">Click to open the Lot Info Panel. From here you can modify various details about your lot such as Bed and Bath count, and the address / lot name.

You can also see your Lot's current Lot Value, which is the sum of all architecture and objects on the lot.</Text> <Text Key="3CCB62A4">Each Lot Type has a set of required objects that must be satisfied in order for it to be considered a lot of a specific type. Click on the View / Hide Progress button to show the required object list and how much of it has been satisfied.</Text> <Text Key="110A30DE">The Lot Type is also found in the Lot Info Panel. Lot Type determines the type of Sims a lot will attract.

Lots that Sims live on can only be Residential. Empty Lots or Venue Lots can be set to a variety of different Lot Types.

ProTip: Use Manage Worlds to edit empty / venue lots.</Text> <Text Key="27DE2CD7">Lot Info Panel</Text> <Text Key="A9E69D26">Creating a Sim with Genetics is a fun and effective way to build a family. Learn more? NOT USED</Text> <Text Key="1DFF7A6E">When creating a Sim by Playing with Genetics, relationships are automatically applied.
 Note: If you select Sibling as their relationship, you have the option of creating a twin!</Text> <Text Key="8FDA51F3">Click on the Add a Sim button and choose Playing with Genetics to add a new Sim to your household that uses the other household members as their 'gene pool'.</Text> <Text Key="8E75F2BC">In the Genetics panel, choose a Relationship (Child, Sibling, or Parent), pick who they are related to, select Gender and Age, and roll your new Sim by clicking the Randomize button.
 If you like the result, click the Checkmark to add the new Sim to your household.</Text> <Text Key="75A08966">Add a Genetic Sim</Text> <Text Key="A070344A">Rotate your Sim to the side to access even more drag options for your Sim!
 Note: Some parts of the body can only be modified from a side view, such as belly size.</Text> <Text Key="9ACE9D47">If you don't want to start from scratch, click on your Sim's body and choose the Body option from the context menu. The Bodies and Skin Tone catalog includes common and extreme body shapes that you can simply pick and use!
 Note: This will modify your Muscle and Fat settings.</Text> <Text Key="D03D357E">Click and drag on any part of your Sim's body, to create uniquely shaped Sims!</Text> <Text Key="FF7A4235">Body Modifiers / Presets</Text> <Text Key="9ECD9A29">Use the arrows below your Sim to Rotate to set positions.
 Or hold the right mouse button and drag to rotate your Sim with greater precision.</Text> <Text Key="254FEA06">Can't drag the part of your Sim you were hoping to? Rotate your Sims to find and manipulate other points of the face and body.</Text> <Text Key="1CCAB99B">You can use the mouse wheel to zoom the camera in and out with greater precision.
 Pro Tip: The [+]/[-] keys can also be used to control the camera zoom.</Text> <Text Key="A4FF2170">Click on your Sim's Head to zoom in to the face to see more detail. Click away from the face or click on your Sim's body to zoom out and see the full Sim.</Text> <Text Key="ABCEFE9C">Camera Controls</Text> <Text Key="8163318C">Create a Sim starts you off with a pre-made Sim to mold and transform. Want to see something different? Click Randomize to quickly see what's possible.</Text> <Text Key="097BD4C1">Like what you've made? Share your creations to the Gallery!
 Click the Save Household button to save your Sims to your personal Library, or share them to the Gallery for others to download and enjoy!</Text> <Text Key="D651D7A5">Once you've found a starting point, you can directly interact with your Sim! Click on what they are wearing to see clothing choices. Click and drag on the body or face to shape them.
 Rotate your Sim using the arrows to modify the body from different angles. Pro Tip: The [<]/[>] keys can also rotate your Sim.</Text> <Text Key="81EFCC34">Welcome to The Sims 4 Create a Sim!
 This lesson will provide a quick overview of the features available in Create a Sim! To learn more, select any lesson from this Lessons panel. Or, click on the buttons to see what happens.</Text> <Text Key="88272D6B">Select an Aspiration, Traits, Voice, and Walk Style for your Sim! Don't forget to name your Sim!</Text> <Text Key="BC6ED68F">Expand your household with the Add a Sim button. You can Play with Genetics to add a child, sibling (twins!), or parent.
 Click the Edit Relationships to define relationships between the members of your household.</Text> <Text Key="017E30D5">Create a Sim</Text> <Text Key="BCC3D923">You can add Sims to this household in Household management. NOT USED</Text> <Text Key="E1A07686">Once you have finished playing in Detail Edit Mode, click Exit Detail Edit Mode or click on an open spot on the screen to return to Face Mode, where your adjustments remain for overall scaling and position.</Text> <Text Key="494FBED8">Detail Edit Mode exposes a separate layer of adjustments on most parts of your Sim's face.
 Activate Detail Edit Mode by zooming into the face (click on the face) and then clicking on the Detail Edit Mode button or Double Click on any facial feature</Text> <Text Key="EE3D0C2C">Detail Edit Mode</Text> <Text Key="2F086579">There is an important lesson on how the New Face parts work. You cannot achieve the look of one shape by manipulating another -- Choose an archetype carefully!

 Click the Open Filter Panel arrow at the top of a clothing catalog to view the Filter options.</Text> <Text Key="A0F6C7DF">Pro Tip: Filters can be used to modify Outfit Categories. If you don't want to be limited to Sleepwear for sleeping, turn off the Outfit Category filter, and find exactly what you want with other filter options.</Text> <Text Key="C2F89B54">Filters are additive, all items conform to the filters on the list. If nothing shows up in the catalog for your selection (your desire for a Red and Blue, Cotton blend, Designer Basics Sleep outfit may be too specific), try turning off some of your filter options.
 To remove a filter, click on the [x] for the one you wish to remove, or click the Clear All button to start over.</Text> <Text Key="6DDF74C7">How Filters Work</Text> <Text Key="C0FE880B">Muscle and Fat adjustments apply to the entire Sim. Muscle controls define shape and size, while Fat controls a layer of 'soft' bulk.
 Click on your Sim's body to access the Muscle and Fat sliders. Click and drag the sliders to adjust them.</Text> <Text Key="BB9AF939">Modifications to the body can be added to enhance or hinder the effects of the Muscle and Fat sliders.
 Try dragging the Fat slider all the way to the top, and then drag the parts of your Sim's body to create a unique shape that suits your desires!</Text> <Text Key="438E3AE9">Muscle and Fat Sliders</Text> <Text Key="69AEB589">Your Sim can have outfits for all occasions.  Click on the occasion icons at the top of any clothing catalog to begin customizing that outfit!</Text> <Text Key="72D7D243">To change the clothes in an outfit, select that outfit category and start trying new clothes on! What the Sim is wearing is the current outfit.</Text> <Text Key="C2E891B2">Each category sets a preset filter of clothing options to choose from. A must for all nightclubs, movie premieres and banks.</Text> <Text Key="B21A7E89">The Velvet Rope</Text> <Text Key="A35ECEBB">The stark blankness of the large fencing panels is softened by the rounded curves of hardwood fence posts.</Text> <Text Key="3059891A">Paneled Fence with Round Posts</Text> <Text Key="62BAA04F">Due to a catastrophic error in the logic of our fence-crafting robot AI, our assembly line of robots suddenly forgot how to make straight lines and produced these intricate fences. While not strictly mission-style, they are pretty nice looking. Dinosaurs had brains the size of peas. That's why they all died. Enjoy your painting.</Text> <Text Key="92A9089E">Trace Remains</Text> <Text Key="A37F311A">Never fall in love with a plankton. Flowing wherever the current takes them, they are total vagabonds. Here's one such plankton, dancing with groupies after a night playing electric guitar with the Bacteria Band. Fortunately this moment was captured in art. We'll never see him again.</Text> <Text Key="A703B445">The Drifter</Text> <Text Key="9638274E">They say each snowflake is unique. Up close, these snow crystals, secure in their individual flakiness, appear to be gathering around one deformed snow pyramid, who they will shortly beat up for being TOO different. As this painting reveals, snow is not as gentle as it seems.</Text> <Text Key="4115B471">Snow Fight</Text> <Text Key="02F510E2">Isn't it strange how zooming in on a fossilized leaf actually makes it look similar to a piece of steak? Are plants and animals more alike than they seem? Do leaves also feel love and fear? What does this say about veganism? Should we eat anything at all? Art raises some serious questions.</Text> <Text Key="F8EB845D">Leaf Meat</Text> <Text Key="16CC6136">If there's one thing we've learned through microscopic explorations into the mineral world it's this: Rocks sure are trippy! Here we have Dunite, magnified fifty zillion percent and captured in bright tempera. Hang it in a college dorm room! </Text> <Text Key="52894B69">Psychedelic Rock</Text> <Text Key="6F683B3E">Magnification reveals interesting facts about microorganisms, such as their preference for bubble gum pink décor and festive streamers hung in their living rooms, all year round. If life on earth were a giant party, microorganisms were the first to arrive, and as this painting reveals, they may be the last to leave!</Text> <Text Key="0D28FEC1">Party in hoop performance team mid-rehearsal, for a number that will sink into obscurity when, en route to a gig, the entire team is eaten by a turtle.</Text> <Text Key="BFB249F6">Hooplankton</Text> <Text Key="B30372D5">Don't have a green thumb? No problem. Enjoy plants at the cellular level, where they're actually blue—and in art form, where they require no water, sunlight or "Please don't leave me!" pep talks.</Text> <Text Key="B7A62EF0">Rhapsody in Blue</Text> <Text Key="F990C9E7">Evoking all the colors of autumn, this mineral painting represents the diminished glow of youth, and the twilight years of life, when all hope is gone, and the path we have taken slides toward its eventual tear-filled end. Hang it in the breakfast nook or the baby's nursery!</Text> <Text Key="D6D5DF1E">Falling</Text> <Text Key="06D6D529">Look at the precision fit of these bright cells. No wonder they're called the "building blocks of life." In fact, the only difference between toy blocks and living cells is that organisms are not assembled by children. (Except for the platypus; that was built by a third grader named Frank.)</Text> <Text Key="F5B64C0C">Cell Block</Text> <Text Key="EF5205F4">At the crux of hard science and new age woo-woo lies the crystal. Here, we can see both the distinctive crystal geometry, revered by scientists for its electrical, optical and mechanical properties, and the glittery crystal sparkles, known for their harmonic love vibrations and aura cleansing magic.</Text> <Text Key="538FCC5B">Crystal Palace</Text> <Text Key="EF2466CB">This artwork chronicles the awkward adolescent stage of plant cell development, where they are tormented by embarrassing acne. Absorbing enough rainwater can really help, and fortunately, a cell can just divide to create its own prom date.</Text> <Text Key="D19B3B4A">Blemish Blossom</Text> <Text Key="5D9B1DC8">In space, cloudy days trump sunny ones. This star-spangled horizon contains countless constellations, each of which can be read for information about the future.
